Metadata: Characterizatio​n of vanadium bromoperoxidase from "Macrocystis" and "Fucus:" reactivity of vanadium bromoperoxidase toward acyl and alkyl peroxides and bromination of amines

Vanadium bromoperoxidase (V-BrPO) has been isolated and purified from the marine brown algae "Fucus distichus" and "Macrocystis pyrifera." V-BrPO catalyzes the oxidation of bromide by hydrogen peroxide, resulting in the bromination of certain organic acceptors or the formation of dioxygen. V-BrPO also catalyzes the oxidation of bromide using peracetic acid. In contrast to hydrogen peroxide, V-BrPO does not catalyze formation of dioxygen from peracetic acid in either the presence or absence of bromide. V-BrPO also uses phenylperacetic acid, "m"-​chloroperoxyben​zoic acid, and "p"-​nitroperoxybenz​oic acid to catalyze the oxidation of bromide; dioxygen is not formed. V-BrPO does not catalyze bromide oxidation or dioxygen formation with the alkyl peroxides ethyl hydroperoxide, "tert"-butyl hydroperoxide, and cuminyl hydroperoxide.
